page.title: 02A Typical Farm
page.content: There are at least seven farms in this area. Mostly mixed farming with arable land and pasture for grazing. One farm typical of the area, with approximately 1471 hectares has 128 head of beef cattle, Hereford cross bred Friesians, 221 breeding ewes, Border Leicester and Suffolk crosses. One Jersey cow which provides milk for the house and a small herd of Warwick long horns as a hobby. Three quarters of the land is arable and a quarter is grazing. The crops grown are Wheat, Barley,Oats and Rape. Farm equipment used by this farmer is 5 tractors, 1 combine harvester, baler, seed drills and ploughs.He employs 2 full time workers, plus casual labour when required. An agricultural contractor who lives in Lyddington is available when needed.
